Notebooks.Rating: 4/4 - Haiku works with all (or nearly all) components
Notebooks.Startup_media: USB storage media (using USB 3.0), USB storage media (using Legacy/USB 2)
Notebooks.CPU: AMD A12-9720P RADEON R7, 12 COMPUTE CORES 4C+8G
Notebooks.Graphics_status: Graphics work, but in Safe Graphics mode or Vesa
Notebooks.Sound_status: Sound works, by default or out of the box
Notebooks.Networking_status: Networking does not work on this computer
Notebooks.Input_status: Neither the trackpad and keyboard work
Notebooks.Power_status: Haiku detects the battery and shows charge time correctly
Notebooks.Cam_status: Cameras do not work with Haiku on this computer

Notebooks.Startup_mode: Legacy BIOS (this laptop doesn’t have UEFI)
Notebooks.Networking_cards: Realtek RTL81xE PCI Express Fast Ethernet controller and Broadcom BCM4312 802.11b/g LP-PHY
Notebooks.Webcams: HP Webcam-50, not recognized, not working
Notebooks.Sound_status: Sound card recognized, volume control works, sound not playing
Notebooks.Networking_status: Ethernet works, WiFi doesn’t work (needs proprietary firmware, Linux installs it with b43-fwcutter, more info here)
Notebooks.Power_status: Battery appears, PowerStatus reports percentage fine
Notebooks.Additional_notes_pt2: Touchpad is Synaptics, edge scrolling works, right click doesn’t work, unlike my Acer here it gets recognized as a PS/2 mouse instead of a touchpad, configure as a 1 button mouse and use ctrl+click to right click
Notebooks.Additional_notes_pt4: When inserting an SD card reader Haiku becomes unresponsive for about 30 seconds, after that it works and can read the card
Notebooks.Additional_notes_pt5: Mic is recognized but SoundRecorder doesn’t record anything

Notebooks.Rating: 3/4 - Haiku works with most of the components
Notebooks.Startup_mode: (U)EFI, but because my computer only supports EFI (64-bit)
Notebooks.Graphics_status: Graphics work, by default or out of the box
Notebooks.Sound_status: Sound works, but by using OpenSound, etc
Notebooks.SD_status: SD drive does NOT work with Haiku
Notebooks.Power_status: Haiku detects the battery and shows charge time correctly
Notebooks.Additional_notes: Screen orientation, nor HDPI scaling didn’t work at all.
